newsitem.title: USA: Senator sees Clinton weakness on US budget balance.
newsitem.headline: Senator sees Clinton weakness on US budget balance.

text.p: U.S. Senate Republican Leader Trent Lott said Thursday he had seen no evidence that President Clinton was showing the leadership needed to reach a balanced budget by 2002.
The Mississippi Republican told reporters: "My pulse rate on any hope is weakening a little bit on whether he will go as far as he needs to on a balanced budget."
He said he had not seen anything to demonstrate "sufficient leadership and courage" that was needed by the president to get to a balanced budget.
Lott added, however, that he was sure that the White House budget plan was "work in progress."
